1.brief: a burden; specifically, tribute, or (abstractly) porterage; figuratively, an utterance, chiefly adoom, especially singing; mental, desire
Babel (i.e. Babylon), including Babylonia and the Babylonian empire
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of
Jeshajah, the name of seven Israelites
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)

2.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
a flag; also a sail; by implication, a flagstaff; generally a signal; figuratively, a token
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
to quiver (i.e. vibrate up and down, or rock to and fro); used in a great variety of applications (including sprinkling, beckoning, rubbing, bastinadoing, sawing, waving, etc.)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
an opening (literally), i.e. door (gate) or entrance way
properly, voluntary, i.e. generous; hence, magnanimous; as noun, a grandee (sometimes a tyrant)

3.brief: to be (causatively, make, pronounce or observe as) clean (ceremonially or morally)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
arrogance or majesty; by implication, (concretely) ornament

4.brief: a noise, tumult, crowd; also disquietude, wealth
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
resemblance; concretely, model, shape; adverbially, like
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
uproar (as of rushing); by implication, destruction
dominion, i.e. (abstractly) the estate (rule) or (concretely) the country (realm)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)

5.brief: to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
remoteness, i.e. (concretely) a distant place; often (adverbially) from afar
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
something prepared, i.e. any apparatus (as an implement, utensil, dress, vessel or weapon)
strictly froth at the mouth, i.e. (figuratively) fury (especially of God's displeasure with sin)
to wind tightly (as a rope), i.e. to bind; specifically, by a pledge; figuratively, to pervert, destroy; also to writhe in pain (especially of parturition)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

6.brief: to howl (with a wailing tone) or yell (with a boisterous one)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

7.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to slacken (in many applications, literal or figurative)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the heart (as the most interior organ);
a man in general (singly or collectively)
to liquefy; figuratively, to waste (with disease), to faint (with fatigue, fear or grief)

8.brief: to tremble inwardly (or palpitate), i.e. (figuratively) be (causative, make) (suddenly) alarmed or agitated; by implication to hasten anxiously
a hinge (as pressed in turning); also a throe (as a phys. or mental pressure); also a herald or erranddoer (as constrained by the principal)

a rope (as twisted), especially a measuring line; by implication, a district or inheritance (as measured); or a noose (as of cords); figuratively, a company (as if tied together); also a throe (especially of parturition); also ruin
to seize (often with the accessory idea of holding in possession)
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage
properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
near, with or among; often in general, to
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
a flash; figuratively, a sharply polished blade or point of aweapon
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

9.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a criminal, or one accounted guilty
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

10.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a star (as round or as shining); figuratively, a prince
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
any notable constellation; specifically Orion (as if a burly one)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
to be dark (as withholding light); transitively, to darken
the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the earth (as moist and therefore inhabited); by extension, the globe; by implication, its inhabitants; specifically, a particular land, as Babylonia, Palestine
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to repose, i.e. desist from exertion; used in many implied relations (causative, figurative or specific)
arrogance or majesty; by implication, (concretely) ornament
to depress or sink (expectation figuratively, to humiliate, intransitive or transitive)

12.brief: properly, apparently, to be heavy, i.e. (figuratively) valuable; causatively, to make rare (figuratively, to inhibit)
a man in general (singly or collectively)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
properly, something carved out, i.e. ore; hence, gold (pure as originally mined)
Ophir, the name of a son of Joktan, and of a gold region in the East

properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

to undulate (as the earth, the sky, etc.; also a field of grain), particularly through fear; specifically, to spring (as a locust)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)

a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

splendor (as conspicuous); also a gazelle (as beautiful)
to push off; used in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (to expel, mislead, strike, inflict, etc.)
a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)

properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
to stab; by analogy, to starve; figuratively, to revile
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, to scrape (literally, to shave; but usually figuratively) together (i.e. to accumulate or increase) or away (i.e. to scatter, remove, or ruin; intransitively, to perish)
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement

a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

silver (from its pale color); by implication, money

properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

a widow; also a desolate place
